item.title: Report E-2024040125
item.description:
Report E-2024040125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 15, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel removed the damaged pails and overpacked them in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized absorbent pads to further remove any paint and contained all spent absorbents in the same (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040098
item.description:
Report E-2024040098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Klean Strip Denatured Alcohol released from one of the 1-gallon jugs in the box due to improper loading by NMP (a heavier piece of freight fell on it in transit). The release was absorbed by the cardboard box it was in. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The impacted box was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040105
item.description:
Report X-2024040105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND RESPONSE CART TO SOUTH PRIMARY SORT AISLE TO PICK UP REPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE. RECTANGULAR PACKAGE IS INTACT, DISCOLORED AND SLIGHTLY SOFT ON ONE END. NO SPILLAGE TO CLEAN UP. PUT THE PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TOTE AND PROMPTLY RETURNED IT TO THE PSC CAGE. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND LARGE 3" DIAMETER TABLETS LINING TWO SIDES OF THE BOX AND A PLASTIC BIN INSIDE. THE PLASTIC BIN HAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 YELLOW DIAMOND LABEL PRINTED ON ONE SIDE. THE LID SEAL ON THE BIN IS INTACT AND SEALED. THE LOOSE TABLETS AND SOME SMALL WADS OF NEWSPAPER LINE 2 SIDES OF THE BOX. THERE ARE NO LABELS ON THE USED OUTER CARTON, EXCEPT A PIECE OF PAPER TAPED ON BEARING THE NUMBERS 525D-619-010. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND SUBMITTED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT REPORT. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE ENTERED INTO ETT AND HELD FOR INSPECTION.

  • Description: 157-40574063 ORD/KTM Total 1 Pcs/ 153 Kgs Shipment booked as ELI for QR8116/20MAR2024 and arrived at Qatar Airways facility. However, Commodity in AWB indicated"Consolidation" without any lithium battery statement. Cargo piece is on hold at the Qatar Airways Cargo facility and advised Shipper of undeclared battery in AWB.

item.title: Report E-2024040065
item.description:
Report E-2024040065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN3066-impacted trailer. ES crews found one damaged 5-gallon bucket and tightened the lids of two other buckets. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal

item.title: Report E-2024040063
item.description:
Report E-2024040063

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 18, 2024 at 2000 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, IL regarding the release of approximately (1) quart of Ammonium Hydroxide Solution (Corrosive liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., UN3266, 8, II) from (1) 5-Liter poly bottle. The total amount of 5 liter bottles in this shipment was unknown. Terminal personnel cleaned the original spill and needed a contractor to address the leftover residue on the surface. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival clarified that the area that needed to be cleaned was not the original spill area, but a section of the OS&D area where some of this material was spilled when it was placed into the waste bucket. The impacted area initially pH tested around a 10-11 so contractors utilized Simple Green and Acid Gator to bring it down to a 7. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040027
item.description:
Report X-2024040027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE SORT AISLE ACROSS FROM BAY 33. DONNED FULL PPE (BAGGS) AND GOT SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE AND WENT TO THE SPILL. ON INSPECTION, IT WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR A CORROSIVE HAZMAT AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THEN CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024040024
item.description:
Report X-2024040024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CLERK NOTICED HAZMAT PACKAGE IS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND SMELLS. CLERK NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND THEN SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND DOWN A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARIVED AT THE SPILL WITH PROPER PROTECTION ON AND SUPPLIES. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE HAZMAT LEAKER AND CLEANED UP WHATEVER ELSE WAS LEAKED ONTO.

item.title: Report E-2024040029
item.description:
Report E-2024040029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of corrosive liquid had a faulty cap and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and cardboard packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel overpacked the damaged jug into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040011
item.description:
Report X-2024040011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LOADER NOTICED HAZMAT PACKAGE ALREADY WET FROM THE AUTOMATED BELT. LOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR. SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND DOWN DESIGNATED RESPONDER. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPILL WITH THE NECCESARY PROTECTION AND SUPPLIES. DESIGNATED RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE LEAKER AND CLEANED UP WHATEVER LEFT OF THE SPILL.
